thread.title: Ground News - Family, West Stanly firefighters reunite after carbon monoxide leak - The Stanly News & Press
thread.title_full: Ground News - Family, West Stanly firefighters reunite after carbon monoxide leak - The Stanly News & Press

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Family, West Stanly firefighters reunite after carbon monoxide leak - The Stanly News & Press
text:
Summary by Ground News A passing storm caused a power outage at the Oakboro home of Curtis and Anita Barbee. Their gas fireplace logs, a common accessory in many homes, malfunctioned, leaking deadly carbon monoxide fumes into the house. The colorless and odorless fumes triggered the CO detector in the home security system. West Stanly Fire Department dispatched to the home, found the three Barbees safely outside. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
The Stanly News & Press Center High Factuality Family, West Stanly firefighters reunite after carbon monoxide leak - The Stanly News & Press Late in the afternoon of Dec. 17, a passing storm caused a power outage at and around the Oakboro home of Curtis and Anita Barbee. “With the power out, we didn’t have heat or water,” said Curtis, “so we turned on our gas logs to get some heat.” Curtis’ 92-year-old mother, Virginia, was in the same predicament at her nearby house, so Curtis soon had her to join him and Anita at their home to stay warm. As the power outage stretched into the late …
